title: Interrupting daily creed for a head of state
vignette: While reciting a mandatory daily creed, you notice the nation’s authoritarian leader approaching; failure to greet could be punishable by death.

options.text: Pause and greet to protect your life.

title: Interrupting daily creed for a revered mentor
vignette: A student is midway through the daily creed when their most respected professor walks by, and etiquette calls for an immediate greeting.

title: Personal prayer during paid work hours
vignette: Employees wish to perform a long personal prayer ritual while still on the company clock.

options.text: Shorten it so as not to misuse work time.

title: Praying while transporting valuable goods
vignette: A delivery driver with a truck full of merchandise reaches their scheduled prayer time. Proper devotion requires standing outside, but stopping could invite theft or other danger.

options.text: Stop and pray on foot despite the risk.
Stay in the driver’s seat and pray as best as possible.

title: Immediate solo creed vs. delayed group creed
vignette: You can recite the daily creed alone now at the ideal time, or wait fifteen minutes to recite it with a group service.

options.text: Wait and recite with the group.

title: Group thanksgiving vs. urgent work obligation
vignette: After a meal with colleagues, they prepare to say a group thanksgiving blessing, but you have an urgent work deadline.

options.text: Stay and participate in the group blessing.
Leave early to meet the work obligation.

title: Protecting a sacred amulet in a public restroom
vignette: You wear a small sacred amulet but must enter a public restroom. Leaving it outside risks theft; bringing it in feels disrespectful.

options.text: Leave it outside to preserve its sanctity.
